data.title: Slow service
data.text:
Would not recommend this restaurant, unless you enjoy the server forgetting your food. We had to look for our waitress and ask after a very long time. (way over an hour). Didn’t even apologize for taking so long.    Took forever to get our drink.  Ordered appetizer (calamari) not good at all no flavor what so ever. Calamari was undercooked and laid out on a bed of marinara making it very soggy . We thought the pizza was below average.
Will not be returning.

data.title: A Tinley Park Gem
data.text: We were attracted to this restaurant, because (that evening) they were offering a promotion that would contribute 10% of the total bill of any/all members of a local church, which could be a considerable sum. Well, it paid off, handsomely, for both the restaurant and the church. When we went, the place was packed. We were invited to wait 20 minutes or eat at an outside table. We chose to eat outside, where the high temperature was moderated by a nice breeze. The waitresses appeared over-worked, but were pleasant and efficient. Our meals were delivered quickly, and were delicious! Everyone around us seemed to enjoy the atmosphere and their meals, as well. Tinley Park has a gem in its community.

data.title: Delicious food!
data.text: Everything we ate was delicious!  Their TACO pizza is the best pizza I've ever had, its to die for.  Our waitress was very attentive, everyone was kind, atmosphere was fun, and very kid-friendly!  Will be returning.

data.title: Nice place to go
data.text: We went here today during the block party. So it was packed but the waitress was very friendly. We ordered right away. Food took a little while but that is to be expected since it was packed. I ordered the PBJ Burger.. it was so good. I submitted a photo so you can see. I would definitely go again to have this burger. The staff were great even when it was full. Wouldn't mind going again. Had a great experience

data.title: Lunch
data.text: Multiple selection of a Great Chicago style pizza made to order!  A chain store pizza  does not look, taste, smell or compare to  Ed & Joes Pizza!!!  This pizza is great, drop that store bought pizza or chain pizza and go to Ed & Joe's!

data.title: Quality survives the test of time.
data.text: From Pizza to Pasta, Ed & Joe's has survived the test of time. Why? because of "Quality". Yes, from the excellent pizza to many pasta dishes, and excellent beef Ed & Joe's is the family restaurant in downtown Tinley that provides a friendly atmosphere with great service and good prices.

data.title: BEST PIZZA EVER
data.text: I lived in Tinley Park the first 16 years of my life and Ed & Joe's was my favorite pizza.  I moved to Florida 30 years ago and I still visit this place every time I go return home.  I've even taken of advantage of their shipping (YES - IT IS TOTALLY WORTH THE COST) several times.  I adore thin crust pizza and Ed & Joe's has the best!  Their sausage is melt in your mouth.  My picky teenager doesn't eat many things but she'll scarf down some pizza from Ed & Joe's.  I'm returning home for a visit this week and I can already taste this pizza!

data.title: Lunch with buddys
data.text:
Went here for afternoon lunch with some old buddys
Great pizza
Extra thin crust was perfectly cooked
Nice staff too
Nice big place great for large groups or couples too
Been here for a long time (50's they said)
Never seen it with all the times I've been on Oak Park ave

data.title: Ed & Joes
data.text: Excellent pizza. Crust is very thin and it is always good. We bring the entire family here because it is a favorite for all of them and most of our out of town company for famous Chicago pizza. I don't particularly like the other food on the menu although I haven't tried much else since you can't go wrong with the pizza.

data.title: Best pizza joint in the South Suburbs!
data.text: Awesome thin crust pizza, none better in the South burbs in my opinion. and scmods (must get the scmods appetizer!).  The menu is really nice if you'd like something other than pizza with a variety of other choices I've never been disappointed.

data.title: Enjoyed the Thin Crust
data.text: Received a gift card to this restaurant and used it Saturday night.  Ordered fried zucchini for an appetizer.  It was good but not "home made" ... probably from a restaurant supply place that comes frozen in a bag.  We had a thin crust cheese and sausage pizza.  We enjoyed it but thought it was on the salty side.  Lots of items on the menu.  They were busy on a Saturday night but the wait really wasn't that long.  We would probably go back and try it again.

data.title: Okay Pizza!
data.text: After reading all of the great reviews, we decided to try Ed and Joe's, since we have lived in Tinley Park since 1978. We  thought the pizza was average for Tinley Park. The cheese was browned nicely---sausage was not what I was expecting. People rave over the crust---I didn't get much out of it. For the price, I would not go back.

data.title: Good food, but slow service
data.text: I have visited Ed and Joe's several times with a group.  Each time they put us in a small room that was very, very warm.   We were so crowded it was difficult to get up.  The service was very slow and several orders were wrong.   Once we had our food, it tasted excellent, but the overall experience was not good.   I waited almost one hour for a sandwich.

data.title: Good thin crust pizza and more!
data.text: I will say up front that I am a Chicago, thin crust pizza snob.  Ed & Joe's is one of my .  favorite spots for this.  Sausage is made in house, sauce is savory and satisfying.  Their soups are goo and they have good salads.  Get the pizza well done and you will be satisfied. The room gets a little loud because they have frequent promotions (trivia, bingo) in the bar which opens into the dining area.

data.title: Great thin crust pizza
data.text: Been going here for over 20 years--pizza is still great!  We ordered double sausage, and it was just a little slight?

data.title: Thin crust pizza is to die for
data.text: The hand thrown crust is delightful and crisp. Make sure you order one with sausage. It's made at the restaurant. The service was friendly and responsive. We will definitely eat here next time we visit!

data.title: great Pizza
data.text: we go there quite often for there pizza.  We love their thin crust and earning point on our meals for coupons to use later there.

data.title: Best pizza in town
data.text: Perfect cooked thin crust pizza with perfect portions of cheese & sausage. Great family restaurant. If pizza is not your taste then try the daily specal meal or great sandwich choises.

data.title: Place to go in Tinley Park
data.text: Excellent food and service at reasonable prices.  Enough TV's to see the Blackhawks, but not so many that it looks like a kids sports bar.

data.title: Outstanding Pizza
data.text: Love the historical essence of Ed and Joe's.  The pizza, just wonderful.  Not if but when you get here to try the pizza, they also have a taco pizza that will really knock your socks off.   I truly hope you enjoy your visit, wonderful place to meet and eat!
